    • Method Detail

      • getPermutations

        public static ArrayList<Integer[]> getPermutations(int N)
        Generates all possible permutations on N letters, returning arrays of the indices {0,..., N-1}. There are clearly N! such permutations. Algorithm is taken from Art of Computer Programming, 7.2.1.2, Algorithm P.
        Parameters:
        N - positive integer.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of integer arrays, each representing a permutation.

      • getLexicographicPermutations

        public static ArrayList<Integer[]> getLexicographicPermutations(int N)
        Returns all permutations on N letters, in numeric order.
        Parameters:
        N -

      • getNextPermutation

        public static Integer[] getNextPermutation(Integer[] permutation)
        Returns the next lexicographically ordered permutation after the given permutation.
        Parameters:
        permutation -
        Returns:
        the next permutation.

      • calculateRank

        public static int calculateRank(Integer[] permutation)
        Calculates the rank of the given permutation on N letters, where N is the size of the permutation array.
        Parameters:
        permutation -
        Returns:

      • calculateUnrank

        public static Integer[] calculateUnrank(int r,
                                        int n)
        Calculates the unrank of integer r, in the lexicographically ordered set of permutations on n letters. Clearly, r must be in range [0,n!).
        Example:
        calculateUnrank(3, 5); will return the Integer array [0, 1, 3, 4, 2] since this is the rank-3 permutation on 5 letters (index starting at 0).
        Parameters:
        r - rank
        n - size of permutation.
        Returns:
        the unrank of r.

      • parity

        public static int parity(Integer[] permutation)
        Returns the parity of the given permutation. Parity is 1 if the permutation can be rewritten as an even number of permutations, and zero otherwise.
        Parameters:
        permutation -
        Returns:
        0 if even parity, 1 if odd.

      • generateCyclicPermutationSets

        public static ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer[]>> generateCyclicPermutationSets(int n)
        Generates all cyclic permutation sets on n items. Each permutation set is represented as an ArrayList of Integer[]s.
        for example,
        generateCyclicPermutationSets(3) will generate 2! sets of permutations, where each permutation is of order 3, as given by:
        {{[0,1,2], [1,2,0], [2,0,1] },
        { [1,0,2], [0,2,1], [2,1,0]}}        .
        Algorithm taken from The Art of Computer Programming 7.2.1.2, Algorithm C.
        Parameters:
        n - positive integer.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of permutation sets.
